thread.section_title: Jurgen Klopp basically admits Liverpool might not be good enough for the Champions League – Metro
thread.title: Jurgen Klopp basically admits Liverpool might not be good enough for the Champions League
thread.title_full: Jurgen Klopp basically admits Liverpool might not be good enough for the Champions League

author: markbrus88
title: Jurgen Klopp basically admits Liverpool might not be good enough for the Champions League
text:
Jurgen Klopp seems pessimistic about Liverpool’s top four hopes (Picture: Getty) Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has downplayed his side’s chances of qualifying for next season’s Champions League after admitting the Reds might not be good enough to make the top four.
Chelsea v Man Utd preview: Odds stacked against Mourinho in revenge mission The German tactician says that his side were not good enough last season as they finished eighth, and believes if they miss out again this year it will be for the same reason.
Liverpool are currently in fourth place in the Premier League table , but Arsenal are just two points behind with a game in hand, while Manchester United are three points behind and have also played one game less.
Liverpool beat top four rivals Arsenal last week (Picture: Getty) Klopp seems prepared for his side to be overtaken, but admits he’d love to lead the Merseyside giants back into the Champions League.
‘Would it be a disappointment if we don’t reach it? Yes because we think we should qualify for it. Is it possible that we don’t qualify? Yes because of the league, because of the opponents and all that stuff,’ the former Borussia Dortmund boss said.
‘It would be because of us and we have to take that situation like it is. It is our big target of course. We want to do everything to get it.
More: Football Lincoln defender reveals his plan for dealing with Alexis Sanchez 
PSG's crushing Champions League humiliation could prove bad news for Spurs 
Arsenal step up chase for Sanchez replacement by scouting 32-goal sensation 
Liverpool fixtures Burnley (H) – Sun 12 Mar
Man City (A) – Sun 19 Mar
Everton (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Bournemouth (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Stoke City (A) – Sat 8 Apr
West Brom (A) – Sun 16 Apr
Crystal Palace (H) – Sun 23 Apr
‘There are a lot of games to play, lot of things to do. That is how it is. For nobody it is already decided. As long as we have the opportunity I think we should try everything. It is wonderful to play there and it would be important for the club of course.’
MORE: Georginio Wijnaldum reveals why Liverpool keep losing against smaller teams
